education.area: Agricultural Robotics, AI in Agriculture, Precision Agriculture, Deep Learning, Machine Vision
education.studyType: PhD in Biological and Agricultural Engineering
Master of Science in Electrical Engineering

work.name: University of California, Davis
highlights: Developed deep learning-based approach to detect picker activity recognition system using time series Global Positioning System (GPS), Inertial Measurement Unit (IMU), and Weight information during strawberry harvesting.
Developing an automated pipeline to estimate precision yield in strawberry fields throughout the harvesting season based on GPS, IMU, and weight information.

work.name: Washington State University (Pullman, WA)
highlights: Developed and implemented deep learning based fully-supervised algorithms for object(e.g. flowers, fruits, branches, trunk, cordons) detection and segmentation, and 3D localization in fruit crops for agriculture automation.
Developed and implemented deep-learning based weakly supervised computer vision algorithms for flowers and fruits density and yield estimation,localization, counting.

Developed, integrated, and evaluated Robot Operating System (ROS)-based robotic systems (deep learning-based computer  vision, 6-DOF UR5e robot, end-effectors) for blossom thinning and pollination in commercial apple orchards.
Worked on calibration, integration, and data processing of RGB, RGB-D,ToF, multispectral, hyperspectral, thermal cameras as course projects.
Teaching Assistant: Machine Vision for Biological Systems (Fall 2020). Taught graduate classes (Introduction to Deep Learning), and graded homework and projects.

work.name: FFRobotics Inc.
highlights: Supported U.S.-based operation, diagnosis, problem resolution, testing, and documentation of the 12-Linear Arm commercial robotic apple harvester field trial in Washington State.
Collaborated with local and overseas team to design, develop, and integrate machine/deep learning algorithms to identify and localize apples and obstacles (e.g. trunk, branches, trellis wire)

Developed/utilized testing scripts, debugging software, and logging tools to investigate, troubleshoot, and resolve hardware and software problems in field depending on time and resources. Collaborated with the overseas team for problem resolution and feature integration.
Explained robotic and machine vision techniques and results to technical and non-technical audiences.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Outstanding Reviewer
awards.awarder: American Society of Agricultural and Biological Engineers (ASABE)
awards.summary: Selected as one of 21 (~2.6%) outstanding reviewers out of more than 800 reviewers for ASABE Journals in 2021.

awards.title: Winner: 3MT Competition
awards.summary: Winner of WSU College of Agricultural, Human, and Natural Resource Sciences (CAHNRS) 3 Minute Thesis Competition in 2022.

awards.title: Winner: ASABE Annual International Meeting (AIM) Oral Presentation
awards.summary: Selected as one of the winners of ITSC Student Oral Presentation Competition at ASABE Annual International Meeting in 2021.
